---
title: "data-analysis-replication"
output: html_document
---

```{R}
library(tidyverse)
library(dplyr)
#Loading in data set
d <- read_csv(file="~/Desktop/rumiqolqa.csv")
d
```

```{R}
#Means of K measurements from fresh and weathered samples
kf <- mean(d$`K fresh`)
kw <- mean(d$`K weathered`)
kf
kw
```
```{R}
#SD of K measurements from fresh and weathered samples
kfsd <- sd(d$`K fresh`)
kwsd <- sd(d$`K weathered`)
kfsd
kwsd
```
```{R}
#T-test for K
x <- d$`K fresh` - d$`K weathered`
n <- length(x)
t.test(d$`K fresh`, d$`K weathered`, df = n - 1, alternative = "two.sided", paired = TRUE)
```
```{R}
#F test for K
x <- d$`K fresh`
y <- d$`K weathered`
vt <- var.test(x, y)
vt
```

```{R}
library(ggplot2)
library(gridExtra)
```
```{R}
#Making bivariate plot displaying readings of K from weathered and fresh surfaces
gg <- ggplot(data = d, aes(x = `K fresh`, y = `K weathered`)) + geom_point() + geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE, formula = y ~ x)
gg
```
